results.name: Primes of the form "1 [0]_n 7" - with zeros between 1 and 7.
comment: The next term, a(8), has 111 digits. - _Harvey P. Dale_, Nov 12 2011
link: Dario Alejandro Alpern, Factorization using the Elliptic Curve Method.
Makoto Kamada, Prime numbers of the form 100...007.
Index entries for primes involving repunits.
example: 1000000000000000000000007 is a prime with 23 zeros between 1 and 7.
mathematica: Do[ If[ PrimeQ[10^n + 7], Print[10^n + 7]], {n, 100}] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Apr 05 2009 *)
xref: Cf. A088274. - _Robert G. Wilson v_, Apr 05 2009
